heroSubtitle: Small team. Big ideas. We build software that people actually want to use.
gradientText: We build <1>brands that matter</1>, creating digital experiences tailored to your vision. Every project is a partnership, every solution is crafted with purpose.
gallerySubtitle: Every project tells a story of collaboration. Here's how we've helped businesses solve their toughest problems with thoughtful, custom solutions.

galleryCTA.title: Ready to start building?
galleryCTA.description: Every great project starts with a conversation. What's your next move?

desktop.subtitle: Every challenge is an opportunity to build something meaningful. We take what's complicated and make it work beautifully.

mobile.title: Simple solutions for
mobile.subtitle: We take the complicated stuff and make it work beautifully. That's what good software should do.

comerzia.title: Comerzia
comerzia.description: Keep track of your customers and orders without drowning in spreadsheets. Simple tools that actually help you run your business better.

comchat.title: ComChat

rhivo.title: Rhivo
rhivo.description: Manage bookings and schedules for service businesses with simple, reliable tools — calendars, staff management and client bookings in one place.

questions.question: What's your process like?
questions.answer: We start by understanding your problem, then build a solution that actually works. No complicated frameworks or unnecessary features—just what you need.

questions.question: Will you disappear after launch?
questions.answer: Nope. We stick around to make sure everything keeps working. Good software evolves with your business, and we build things so they can grow when you need them to.

questions.question: Can you work with our existing stuff?
questions.answer: Usually, yes. We're pretty good at figuring out how to make new things work with what you already have. If there's a problem, we'll tell you upfront.

questions.question: What if our project is unique?
questions.answer: Unique projects are often the most interesting. If you've got a specific problem that needs solving, we're probably the right people to help figure it out.

hero.description: You know your business better than anyone. We know how to build software that won't let you down. Together, we create something that actually moves the needle.

cta.title: Ready to Partner Up?
cta.description: Let's talk about what you're trying to build and figure out the best way to make it happen.

process.title: How We Work
process.description: Three simple steps that turn your ideas into software that actually works for your business and your users.

analysis.title: Understanding Together
analysis.description: We start by really listening. What's working? What's not? What would make your life easier? We dig deep until we understand exactly what needs to be built.

engineering.title: Building Smart
engineering.description: No over-engineering, no unnecessary complexity. We build exactly what you need using the right tools for the job, keeping things simple and maintainable.

performance.title: Making It Better
performance.description: Launch is just the beginning. We monitor, learn, and continuously improve so your software gets better over time, not worse.

interactiveBlobs.description1: Great software isn't born from templates or quick fixes. It comes from understanding what you really need and having the skill to make it happen.

contact.title: Let's start
contact.subtitle: Have a project in mind? We'd love to hear about it. Drop us a message and let's discuss how we can help bring your ideas to life.

blogSubtitle: Explore cutting-edge perspectives on digital transformation, enterprise architecture, and the future of technology. Stay ahead with insights that drive business innovation.

blogPost2Title: Cloud-Native Architecture: Building Resilient Systems for Scale

blogPost4Title: Data Mesh: Democratizing Data Architecture for Enterprise Success
blogPost4Excerpt: Understand how data mesh principles are revolutionizing enterprise data management and enabling self-serve analytics at scale.
blogPost5Title: DevOps Evolution: Platform Engineering and Developer Experience
blogPost5Excerpt: Discover how platform engineering is transforming DevOps practices and creating superior developer experiences across organizations.
blogPost6Title: Sustainable Technology: Green Computing for Modern Enterprises
blogPost6Excerpt: Learn how organizations are reducing their carbon footprint through sustainable technology practices and green computing initiatives.
aiPostTitle: The Future of Enterprise AI: Beyond Automation to Intelligent Transformation
aiPostExcerpt: Discover how leading organizations are leveraging AI not just for automation, but for complete business model reinvention and competitive advantage.
aiPostSection1Title: The AI Revolution: From Efficiency to Intelligence
aiPostSection1P1: Artificial Intelligence has evolved far beyond simple task automation. Today's leading enterprises are discovering that AI's true potential lies not in replacing human workers, but in augmenting human intelligence and transforming entire business models. This shift represents a fundamental change in how organizations approach technology adoption and strategic planning.
aiPostSection1P2: Companies that once viewed AI as a cost-cutting tool are now recognizing it as a driver of innovation, customer experience, and competitive differentiation. The question is no longer 'How can AI make us more efficient?' but rather 'How can AI help us reimagine what's possible?'
aiPostSection2P1: Successful AI transformation requires more than cutting-edge technology. It demands a holistic approach that encompasses organizational culture, data infrastructure, and strategic alignment. Leading organizations are investing heavily in AI literacy across all levels of their workforce, ensuring that the benefits of intelligent systems are realized throughout the enterprise.
aiPostQuote: The most successful AI implementations are those that amplify human capabilities rather than replace them entirely.
aiPostSection2P2: This approach focuses on creating symbiotic relationships between human expertise and machine intelligence, leading to outcomes that neither could achieve independently.
aiPostSection3P1: From predictive analytics that anticipate market shifts to personalized customer experiences that drive loyalty, AI is reshaping every aspect of business operations. Healthcare organizations are using AI to accelerate drug discovery, financial institutions are leveraging machine learning for risk assessment, and manufacturing companies are implementing intelligent systems for predictive maintenance.
aiPostExample1Text: Organizations are using AI to forecast market trends, customer behavior, and operational challenges before they occur.
aiPostExample2Text: Smart systems that learn and adapt, handling complex decision-making processes with minimal human intervention.
aiPostSection4Title: The Path Forward: Building AI-Ready Organizations
aiPostSection4P1: Creating an AI-ready organization requires careful planning, significant investment, and a commitment to continuous learning. Organizations must focus on developing robust data governance frameworks, investing in talent development, and fostering a culture of experimentation and innovation.
aiPostSection4P2: The future belongs to organizations that can successfully integrate artificial intelligence into their strategic vision while maintaining focus on human values and ethical considerations. This balance will define the next generation of successful enterprises.
aiPostCTATitle: Ready to Transform Your Business with AI?
aiPostCTAText: Our team of AI specialists can help you develop and implement intelligent solutions that drive real business value.
cloudPostTitle: Cloud-Native Architecture: Building Resilient Systems for Scale
cloudPostExcerpt: Learn the essential patterns and practices for designing cloud-native applications that scale effortlessly and maintain high availability.
cloudPostSection1P1: Cloud-native architecture represents a fundamental shift in how we design, build, and operate applications. Unlike traditional monolithic approaches, cloud-native systems are built from the ground up to leverage the full potential of cloud computing environments. This approach embraces microservices, containerization, and dynamic orchestration to create systems that are inherently scalable, resilient, and adaptable.
cloudPostSection1P2: The core principles of cloud-native design—scalability, resilience, observability, and automation—work together to create applications that can handle unpredictable loads while maintaining high availability and performance standards.
cloudPostSection2P1: Successful cloud-native applications rely on proven architectural patterns that address common challenges in distributed systems. These patterns provide blueprints for building robust, maintainable systems that can evolve with changing business requirements.
cloudPostPattern1Text: Breaking applications into small, independently deployable services that communicate through well-defined APIs.
cloudPostPattern2Text: Using events and message queues to create loosely coupled systems that can scale independently.
cloudPostPattern3Text: Implementing fault tolerance mechanisms that prevent cascading failures across distributed services.
cloudPostPattern4Text: Ensuring data independence by giving each service its own database, optimized for its specific needs.
cloudPostSection3P1: Containers have revolutionized how we package and deploy applications, providing consistency across development, testing, and production environments. Kubernetes has emerged as the de facto standard for container orchestration, offering powerful capabilities for managing containerized workloads at scale.
cloudPostQuote: The true power of cloud-native architecture lies in its ability to turn infrastructure into code and operations into automation.
cloudPostSection3P2: Modern orchestration platforms provide automated scaling, health monitoring, and self-healing capabilities that make applications more resilient and reduce operational overhead.
cloudPostSection4P1: In distributed cloud-native systems, observability becomes critical for understanding system behavior and diagnosing issues. The three pillars of observability—metrics, logs, and traces—provide comprehensive visibility into application performance and health.
cloudPostSection4P2: Modern observability platforms use artificial intelligence and machine learning to automatically detect anomalies, predict potential issues, and provide actionable insights for optimization.
cloudPostSection5P1: Security in cloud-native architectures requires a shift-left approach, integrating security considerations throughout the development and deployment pipeline. This includes implementing zero-trust networking, securing container images, and managing secrets and credentials properly.
cloudPostSection5P2: Modern security practices emphasize automated vulnerability scanning, policy-as-code, and continuous compliance monitoring to ensure that security keeps pace with rapid development cycles.
cloudPostCTAText: Our cloud architecture experts can help you design and implement scalable, resilient systems that leverage the full power of cloud-native technologies.

mobileShowcase.title: Mobile First Done Right
mobileShowcase.description: If it doesn't work on a phone, it doesn't work. We build interfaces that feel natural in your hand, with fast load times and transitions that stay out of the way.

landing.heroSubtitle: Automatically detect and redact sensitive information before you share. Everything happens locally, your files never leave your device.
landing.stepsSubtitle: No setup required. Privacy Interceptor works silently in the background.
landing.step1Description: Go about your day. When you upload a file to any website, we step in automatically.
landing.step2Description: Our AI detects phone numbers, emails, IDs, addresses, and other sensitive data in seconds.
landing.step3Description: Review what we found, select what to redact, and share your document worry-free.
landing.feature1Description: Your documents never leave your browser. Zero cloud. Zero tracking.
landing.feature2Description: PDFs, Word docs, images, and text files. We handle them all.
landing.feature3Description: Recognizes ID formats from Europe, Americas, Asia, and Africa.
landing.feature4Description: Reads text from scanned documents and images with precision.
landing.feature5Description: Finds emails, phones, IDs, addresses, and more in milliseconds.
landing.feature6Description: Black bars that can't be undone. Your data stays hidden forever.
landing.pricingSubtitle: No subscriptions. Pay once, own it forever.
landing.collaborateDescription: Privacy Interceptor is made by a small team who cares about privacy. Want to collaborate or have questions? Get in touch.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Interceptor
privacyPolicy.subtitle: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.shortVersionText: We don't collect, store, or transmit any of your data. Period.
privacyPolicy.shortVersionSubtext: All document processing happens entirely on your device. Your files never leave your browser.
privacyPolicy.localStorageIntro: The extension stores the following data locally on your device using Chrome's storage API:
privacyPolicy.localStorageNote: This data never leaves your device, is not transmitted to any server, is not shared with anyone, and can be deleted by uninstalling the extension.
privacyPolicy.process1: When you select a file for upload, Privacy Interceptor intercepts it
privacyPolicy.process2: The file is scanned locally using pattern matching and OCR
privacyPolicy.process3: Sensitive data is detected and shown to you
privacyPolicy.process5: Redaction happens locally on your device
privacyPolicy.process6: The redacted file replaces the original for upload
privacyPolicy.doNot2: Use cloud AI or ML services
privacyPolicy.allUrlsPermissionPurpose: Intercept file uploads on any website
privacyPolicy.allUrlsNote: We request <all_urls> because file uploads can happen on any website. We cannot predict which sites you'll use, so we need broad permission to protect you everywhere.
privacyPolicy.thirdPartyIntro: Privacy Interceptor does not use any third-party services for:
privacyPolicy.thirdPartyNote: The only external resource loaded is the Inter font from Google Fonts for UI styling, which does not transmit any personal data.
privacyPolicy.yourRightsIntro: Since we don't collect any personal data, there's nothing to:
privacyPolicy.yourRightsConclusion: Your privacy is protected by design, not by policy.
privacyPolicy.contactIntro: If you have questions about this privacy policy, contact us at:
privacyPolicy.footerText: Privacy Interceptor is developed by ZondaOne.
